paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its amyloidogenic variant L55P, focusing on its effects on cellular proteome and implications for disease.

functional_data.summary: The TTR-L55P variant shows a higher propensity to misfold and aggregate, leading to amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The paper mentions that many mutation carriers are asymptomatic throughout their lives.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The paper highlights the variability in age of onset among carriers of the L55P variant.
key_quotes: carriers of this amyloidogenic mutation have a very early age at disease onset
many mutation carriers are asymptomatic throughout their lives

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses the TTR-L55P variant without providing specific individual-level penetrance data.
